stem: A client with suspected sepsis has a blood pressure of 88/46 mmHg and a lactate level of 4.5 mmol/L. Select the 4 most appropriate interventions to be completed within the first hour of treatment.

options.text: Schedule a CT scan of the abdomen.
Administer a 30 mL/kg IV bolus of isotonic crystalloids.
Measure follow-up lactate levels if the initial lactate is elevated.
Obtain blood cultures prior to antibiotic administration.

rationale.correct: The 1-hour sepsis bundle includes: measuring lactate (d), obtaining blood cultures (a), administering antibiotics (c), and giving fluid boluses for hypotension/high lactate (b).
rationale.incorrect: Antipyretics, TPN, and CT scans are not part of the core 1-hour bundles for sepsis resuscitation.

answerBreakdown.label: A
answerBreakdown.content: Selecting "Schedule a CT scan of the abdomen." might delay more critical interventions, as it does not address the immediate life-threatening risk.

answerBreakdown.label: B
answerBreakdown.content: Clinically, "Administer a 30 mL/kg IV bolus of isotonic crystalloids." is the most appropriate finding pointing toward the suspected condition and requiring intervention.

answerBreakdown.label: C
answerBreakdown.content: Selecting "Administer oral antipyretics for fever." might delay more critical interventions, as it does not address the immediate life-threatening risk.

answerBreakdown.label: D
answerBreakdown.content: Clinically, "Measure follow-up lactate levels if the initial lactate is elevated." is the most appropriate finding pointing toward the suspected condition and requiring intervention.

answerBreakdown.label: E
answerBreakdown.content: "Initiate total parenteral nutrition (TPN)." is a common distractor; it is either a non-specific finding or an action that follows more urgent stabilization.

answerBreakdown.label: F
answerBreakdown.content: "Start broad-spectrum antibiotics." represents a critical metric that must be monitored to evaluate the effectiveness of the current medical plan.

answerBreakdown.label: G
answerBreakdown.content: "Obtain blood cultures prior to antibiotic administration." represents a critical metric that must be monitored to evaluate the effectiveness of the current medical plan.

clinicalPearls: Lactate > 2 is abnormal; > 4 indicates severe tissue hypoperfusion.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: While finding the source (CT scan) is good, resuscitation (fluids/antibiotics) must ALWAYS happen in the first hour.

mnemonic.title: B-U-N-D-L-E
mnemonic.expansion: Blood cultures, Urine output, Normal saline 30ml/kg, Drugs, Lactate.

reviewUnits.heading: Sepsis
reviewUnits.body: Survivng Sepsis Campaign guidelines emphasize rapid identification.
